com.noctarius.snowcast

Interface SnowcastSequencer


  • @ThreadSafe
public interface SnowcastSequencer

    The SnowcastSequencer interface describes the general sequencer contract. This interface will be backed by different implementations based on client or server mode but is fully transparent to the end user.

    The sequencer is used to generate the snowcast sequence ID and can also be used to extract values from previously generated IDs based on the sequencers configuration (maximal number of logical node IDs and max counter).

    The SnowcastSequencer is acquired by a call to Snowcast.createSequencer(String, SnowcastEpoch) or Snowcast.createSequencer(String, SnowcastEpoch, int) depending on the user preference or need.

    A SnowcastSequencer implementation is expected to be fully thread-safe. Creation as well as all methods need to be aware of concurrent use and multi-threaded access or instance sharing!

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      SnowcastSequencer attachLogicalNode()
      Attaches the current SnowcastSequencer instance to a logical node ID.
      int counterValue(long sequenceId)
      Extracts the counter value of the given snowcast sequence ID based on the current configuration.

      Extracts the timestamp value of the given snowcast sequence ID based on the current configuration.

    • Method Detail

      • getSequencerName

        @Nonnull
String getSequencerName()
        Returns the reference name of the sequencer. This name is shared in the Hazelcast cluster. Whenever the same sequencer name is referenced when creating a SnowcastSequencer the same internal sequencer instance is returned (unless destroyed).
        Returns:
        the sequencers reference name

      • next

        long next()
          throws InterruptedException

        Generates and returns the next snowcast sequence ID. This call blocks until a ID is free to be generated. The call blocks whenever a millisecond on the current node runs out of possible IDs by exceeding the maximum counter value.

        This method is fully thread-safe and expected to be used in multi-threading environments.

        Returns:
        the next available snowcast sequence ID
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - if the blocking wait is interrupted

      • getSequencerState

        @Nonnull
SnowcastSequenceState getSequencerState()
        Returns the current SnowcastSequenceState of this sequencer. It might be attached, detached or destroyed. Please refer to the state documentations to find out more about their meanings.
        Returns:
        the sequencers current state

      • attachLogicalNode

        @Nonnull
SnowcastSequencer attachLogicalNode()
        Attaches the current SnowcastSequencer instance to a logical node ID. This is a cluster operation and blocks until the owner of the reference name assigns a logical node ID and returns it back to the current node or client.
        Returns:
        the current SnowcastSequencer instance for chaining of method calls

      • detachLogicalNode

        @Nonnull
SnowcastSequencer detachLogicalNode()
        Detaches the current SnowcastSequencer instance from the currently assigned logical node ID. This is a cluster operation and blocks until the owner of the reference name removed the logical node ID assignment and returns back to the current node or client.
        Returns:
        the current SnowcastSequencer instance for chaining of method calls

      • timestampValue

        @Nonnegative
long timestampValue(long sequenceId)
        Extracts the timestamp value of the given snowcast sequence ID based on the current configuration. Extracted timestamps are based on the configured SnowcastEpoch. To get the real world point in time the epoch value plus this returned timestamp must be summed together.
        Parameters:
        sequenceId - the sequence ID to extract the timestamp from
        Returns:
        the extracted timestamp based on the configured epoch

      • logicalNodeId

        @Nonnegative
int logicalNodeId(long sequenceId)
        Extracts the logical node ID of the given snowcast sequence ID based on the current configuration. The extracted logical node ID is based no the configured maximal logical node ID (number of bits used).
        Parameters:
        sequenceId - the sequence ID to extract the logical node ID from
        Returns:
        the extracted logical node ID based on the configured maximal logical node ID

      • counterValue

        @Nonnegative
int counterValue(long sequenceId)
        Extracts the counter value of the given snowcast sequence ID based on the current configuration. The extracted counter value is based no the configured maximal logical node ID (number of bits used).
        Parameters:
        sequenceId - the sequence ID to extract the counter value from
        Returns:
        the extracted counter value based on the configured maximal logical node ID
